intro: Peperomia clivigaudens, commonly known as the cliff peperomia, is a compact, low-maintenance plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It features glossy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Peperomia clivigaudens is popular as a houseplant due to its ease of care and attractive foliage.
